title: Error for mismatched types involving generics seems to be missing something

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-papercut
labels.description: Diagnostic error that needs small tweaks

labels.name: D-terse
labels.description: A diagnostic that doesn't give enough information about the problem at hand

body:
```rust
pub fn f<T>(a: &T) -> *const T {
    &1 as *const i32
}
```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=bb91f189e25a1c5eb1698fde13b3948d))

The error includes a label that says "this type parameter", but it doesn't complete the sentence:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/lib.rs:2:5
  |
1 | pub fn f<T>(a: &T) -> *const T {
  |          -            -------- expected `*const T` because of return type
  |          |
  |          this type parameter
2 |     &1 as *const i32
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ expected type parameter `T`, found `i32`
  |
  = note: expected raw pointer `*const T`
             found raw pointer `*const i32`

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.
error: could not compile `playground`

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.

```
